intro: Sida glabra, commonly known as smooth sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters, with simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale yellow flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sida glabra is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
